item.title: Homeless man has returned, 26th November
item.description:
The homeless man that has been sleeping here right since April has returned. Bottles of urine and bedding left which needs clearing. Human waste is dangerous outside of a food serving food, food left by the homeless man attracts vermin.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilmer Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned motor bike or motorised scooter, 26th November
item.description:
At the end of monnery road and Pemberton Terrace there appears to be a motor vehicle parked behind the motorbike locking frames. This vehicle has been left abandoned for some time and is parked illegally on the pavement, If possible can the vehicle be removed as it takes up spaces that could be used by the general public either for bike storage (Such as lime bikes/ bike share programs) instead of them being thrown onto the pavement or car parking spaces
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Monnery Road, Archway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A well known fly tipping spot, 26th November
item.description:
This area was clear and theb one item was brought anf suddenly it became a mass of items. A few builders rent out the garages next to the spot and they ofteb discard their waste products on the road or at that spot

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vigilant Close, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request for Cleaning and Maintenance – Woodsford Building Lifts and Corridors, 26th November
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council Housing Management, I would like to report ongoing issues in our building (Woodsford Portland Street London (Both lifts are in very poor condition and have not been cleaned properly for months. The entrance corridors are also not being maintained. Additionally, dogs have been urinating in the lifts, causing a very strong and unpleasant smell, making them difficult to use. Could you please arrange for the lifts and the entrance corridors to be cleaned as soon as possible? Also, could you place a notice reminding pet owners that dogs are not allowed to urinate inside the lifts? Thank you for your attention and prompt action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: You keep saying you’ve sorted it but the pile keeps growing, 26th November
item.description:
The rubbish pile continues to expand, but you keep saying it’s been sorted. Not quite sure what you think you’re sorted but as you can see from the picture, the rubbish is still very much there and growing.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chapman Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 weeks. No action, 26th November
item.description:
I complained 2 weeks ago. On this service. Yet the council are not at all bothering to sort this mess out. A whole mountain of recycling/non recycling rubbish. Wife complained via phone. Still nothing. What lousy service. And then they come to ask for vot

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harleston Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Come clean your car park!, 26th November
item.description:
Lots of rubbish, fly tipping in car park. Come and clean your car park council since we now pay to park here! Shocking. There’s even a rug in one of the bays that has been here for months. All the leaves at the back need clearing. Shocking. We pay ti park here as residents since you guys ‘own the car park’. You stated that we would be paying towards maintenance. Clearly that’s not the case, jokers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
